comments: 10 Assignments, 13 quizzes, attendance (entering and leaving), offers extra credit opportunities, 1 final, and lectures for every minute of class. I struggled in his class. 2 books are required. Assignments are 3-10 pages long. Quizzes are 10-15 questions. Very motivational. Not approachable. Books are required to understand the material. Nope.....

comments: LOVED his class! Yes, it may be on an awkward Friday night schedule, but Professor Rios makes it worthwhile. This class will broaden your horizons and will make you rethink your actions and behavior. You\'ll learn A LOT about REINFORCEMENT, and why it\'s so vital. Weekly quizzes and class assignments, really easy! CSULA is a better place bc of Rios

comments: There are assignments each week and he expects it to be done precisely. His lectures are based on life experiences, but they are based on he teaches. He is somewhat lenient, he gives extra credit to help students who are struggling in class and need a boost on their grade, but they required thinking and work just as a regular assignment.
